title: Hey riot everyone is down voting your post of the harrowing
body: Because you forgot to say we're sorry we fucked up. Maybe next year.

replies.body: not to be rude or anything, but can someone explain to me why everyone's upset? was harrowing late? idk how thats much of a problem, u know, kinda like kindred

Here's the basic gist of it:

* Riot pushed Harrowing content to the pbe and tested it, announcing it as such. 
* No other in game content was announced, different from previous years (previously, there was a featured game mode or SR reskin). 
* No indication of when the content would be released was given, with Riot prioritizing World's instead. 
* The announcement that Harrowing would not coincide with Halloween was buried on the pbe boards, where very few people saw it. 
* Halloween came and went, with no official Riot comment on Harrowing content all weekend.
* There was still no definite announcement about when the content would be released until several days after the uproar (best we had was "later this week"). 

This isn't even getting into player opinions on how people disagree with separating Harrowing with Halloween. That's all just things compounding to explode in their face about what went wrong.

During October, we released a game mode (One for All), a new story with Shadow and Fortune: A Harrowing Story and we released new skins and Legacy skins this week. We made the decision to split these things up to avoid clumping too many things at once, especially with Worlds earning so much attention. Based on your feedback, this wasn’t the right decision.

We’re looking at how we can fix this in the future and we're listening to better understand what you expect to see for future seasonal events. We'll be the first to admit, this isn't always easy for us, because our seasonal events don’t always feature the same things. But we realize what we did release for The Harrowing didn't meet expectations.

I think that the issue is the fact that you took one of the most favorite events in the game and almost "stripped" it of its identity by not having it on Halloween, which is generally the time where people will want spooky content and such. I get that you want to have the Harrowing "at any time" as you guys put it, so go do that. But there still should be a Harrowing on Halloween, as that is the core of what the Harrowing means to the fanbase. Also, prioritizing Worlds over a favored lore event is not a good idea. I think that steps should be made to make sure that Worlds doesn't coincide with any lore events or game modes, to prevent this issue in the future.

> During October, we released a game mode (One for All)

That's kinda irrelevant when the game mode isn't available for the Holiday though, don't you think? This was my main gripe with the event personally. When I plan on having some fun for Halloween, I usually do it on 31st +/- 1-2 days. However, you removed the fun game mode 4 days before the actual holiday and didn't replace it with anything.
Yeah, we definitely see splitting up the different parts over the course of the month wasn't as effective as we wanted.

Well, it clearly gave less of a "SURPRISE MOTHERFUCKERS HERE'S YOUR EVENT" and more of a "We're cool all year long". Basically, it lacked a "bang". 

1. You released a lore event starting weeks before the actual holiday and ended before the actual holiday.

2. You released a rehashed FGM that wasn't on the map that best fits the holiday, and removed it before the holiday.

3. You took a break near the end of the month to not steal the spotlight.

4. You released the skins after the holiday was over.

So basically, you did a lot of non-overlapping cool stuff all the time except for during the holiday. Also, most of the stuff happened "during the month of october" instead of "around October 31st". For isntance, you could've done something like release OfA (on TT) from Oct 15th to Nov 2nd, start the Lore event on Oct 31st, release the spooky skins as the story ends (or even gradually as the story unfolds)... or something along those lines (I don't recall if there were any other events).

Basically, you can spread them out, but they have to overlap for sure and they have to be spread around the holiday, not spread in the 30 days preceeding the holiday.

That's all just my opinion though, anyone can feel free to call me out if they disagree.

i don't think it was the fact you split it up over the course of a month, i think it's just that you did a poor job of it.

A. if one for all was really for harrowing (which i honestly didn't even think it was) then why wouldn't you run it up to and possibly a few days through halloween (maybe start it later so it isn't up for a really long time)

B. why would you release harrowing skins after halloween and not before. I can understand if they stay in the shop past halloween but it is basically a week later and you only just now released them.

It just seems like you did everything too late.
You contradict yourself. According to all the end of your comment, te problem is indeed that they split it up.

no. i said everything came out too late.

If they wanted to split it up like that they needed to start it all sooner or something. because what is happening now is that the harrowing skins aren't part of halloween anymore, they are too late.
Please don't make this turn you away from that idea. Having events like the Winter event being longer would be great. It's just, for one specific holiday, people want everything on that day.
Snowdown should be just fine. It wont be taking a back seat to an E-sport event like the harrowing did.

I just don't want them to worry about keeping everything closer. Snowdown is a winter event, Harrowing is a Halloween event. Riot doesn't need to let bad reactions to the second one make the first one less enjoyable.
I honestly don't see how OFA would even feeling like a Harrowing game mode.So even if you guys did do everything together,OFA wouldn't be the best choice unless it took place on the Twisted Treeline.

When I look at it from a view that keeps the player base happy while also maximizing profit I think it was a no brainer harrowing should have taken priority. Like without a doubt anybody should have known that. And also with your returning game modes we should also note you should just remove dominion and quite possibly consider using those servers and or increasing servers to host monthly/biweekly/weekly events, so we can see game modes returning more often and generally give players more incentive to play the game aside from ranked, rift or aram. OR if you guys are unwilling to do that then make some altered coop permanent game mode allowed for those who actually enjoy coop vs ai. Such as doom bots. Why these changes have never been implemented or considered baffles me. You guys let dominion left to rot. 

Literally let bots crap all over it and did nothing to keep the hype to it. I literally LOVE dominion and it's by far my favorite game mode but 5min-20min game modes on some days is just too much for somebody like me who works 2 jobs and goes to school. Seriously though. Retire dominion, add it to the list of gamemodes that can return with the other game modes which will use those allocated servers. Simple yet effective change to keep league interesting and give people something to look forward to throughout the month other than random skins that only hype certain people based off of concept or champions people play. Give everyone a reason to look forward to logging on.

As a counterpoint, though, not everyone cares about all of those. I, for example, didn't care about the new skins, and only barely cared about OfA.

As such, the only 'harrowing' celebrations for me were the story. This made the event feel sparse.

Not to mention that decoupling harrowing from halloween is a bad decision, and only putting that announcement only on the PBE boards was an even worse decision. You made so much work for KateyKhaos.

>We made the decision to split these things up to avoid clumping too many things at once, **especially with Worlds earning so much attention.**

Something to consider: Worlds isn't a priority.  Worlds shouldn't even be _considered_ a priority.  The pro scene should NEVER come before the playerbase.  Riot is making this mistake far too many times, especially in Gameplay and Balance.  I would have hoped that this was going to be the only department to consistently screw up, but for every other department since they're a lost cause, please make a habit out of producing content while ignoring the LCS.
Oh, I'm certain you'll fix this in the future.  So long as World's doesn't coincide with the Harrowing, otherwise it'll get dropped off and forgotten about like a prom night dumpster baby.
Pretty sure they stated that the Harrowing can happen at any time so i am pretty sure they can just chose not to make it at the same time as World's.

I think perhaps not having Worlds take up so much of October would be the best.

Maybe it can end in September, or perhaps in mid-October, but not at the VERY end, taking away from the Harrowing event. Perhaps it can end in mid-October, and that would leave the second half of October to feature story content and announcements, and try and lead all of that up to a climax of Harrowing content by October 31st.
Isn't that what happened last year?

I have to say - releasing harrowing skin content built around the Halloween theme a week after Halloween is already over is VERY unsatisfying. 

_**Worlds may be super important but you have to put your effort where it counts - for all of your players who play league and not just for the top 2 teams. **_
Why else would we strive to make it to the top competitively if the game content wasn't there?

You have to remember, there are people and businesses out there that start November 1st at 1201 AM off with **"GET YOUR GIFTS FOR TURKEY ON BLACK CHRISTMAS THIS FRIDAY AND DECORATE PUMPKIN PIE LIGHTS BECAUSE SANTA CLAUS AND HAM TRAIN SETS. NON-STOP CHRISTMAS MUSIC UNTIL THE 1ST OF NEW YEARS LIEUTENANT DAN ICE CREAM." **

I believe Riot did nothing wrong i can't be sure of it but i believe that Riot probably never stated that Harrowing was in any way connected to Halloween (i may be wrong most likely am) and so i believe that if it's their decision to not make the Harrowing event coincide with Halloween it is fully understandable and should come as no surprise as we are talking about a fantasy game world that has no connections with ours so should obviously not have the same events as we do.

The fun part is that all we knew about the release of the skins was provided by Bio, who doesn't even work in that area and just said what she asked to the rioters actually working on it (btw, thans Bio!).
What bothers me was that it seemed they chose Worlds over Harrowing and the community building it has always done.
It's not the Harrowing, per se, it's more on how they handled Halloween.

That is a poor ass defense in our defense. The 'only' Halloween they've missed? They're NOT supposed to miss any, especially after 4 years of tradition. Not with a badly announced, last second bullshitted decision like "We're celebrating Halloween in November and Christmas in February, gg get fukd kids. -rolls away with your monehs-"

Its not entitlement. I made it clear I know I'm not entitled to this when there was initial outcry on the topic. Riot hasn't been listening to their player base much, not to say they haven't been doing a crap ton of cool shit to look forward to, but they've been doing tons of damage to us as well. So its kind of looking bad on their part if they have all this shiny new shit and no one on the playground to share it with.

Did they mess up on Harrowing? Yes. Do they deserve to be lynched? No, not really.

Do we deserve an apology? F*ck yeah. Do we deserve free shit to compensate? While it'd be nice, no.

It's longer than a 4 year tradition. This has been happening since Beta. So has Snowdown Showdown, which is also not going to be coming out at the proper time. Riot said that "It will happen when we say it happens." 

I'm not disagreeing with you, I'm just pointing out that this tradition has been around since beta. So it's been 6-7 years now.

Season 6 looks to be something to look forward to as an apology for the missed halloween, at least we got some good lore and now we can have cool harrowing skins at any time of the year, (CHRISTMAS IN JULY GIF) but yeah and about the listening thing:
I hate saying it because I get destroyed for putting it out there but lets be serious, 9/10 when Rito actually listens to the playerbase on a topic (If this topic doesnt involve simple things like name changes or just little fixes) about balance, things get totally worse than usual. I believe two of the juggernauts had this problem and I know many other changes that have happened because of board outcries have also made things worst on multiple occasions so I could see their lack of listening to the player base. In the end, the boards really on excels on simple changes because the moment anything else comes out (rather than an actual good idea that can be simply implemented ex: recall animations in ARAM) and or providing skin ideas, its terrribleeee for balance and or champion changes. And, i've noticed a lot that people assume everything they say needs to be considered and or put into the game and that rito should follow everything they say, I mean i'm fine with them doing things on their own as they shouldn't feel constricted by the playerbase to always have to do what it wants.
for how often they have stated that they believe in clarity, they really muddied the waters on this one.
